website_summaries.verdict: Durable and safe, this leash will keep your cat contained and comfortable so long as you're in tune. The unique bungee cord provides a flexible give and take unlike other products.
pros: A built-in bungee cord provides comfort that your feline will appreciate
The design is meant to keep your cat safe, yet not make it feel like it's on a leash
cons: The leash is almost too efficient and may create tightness around the harness when pulled abruptly

customer_reviews.title: My cat slipped out of the harness.
customer_reviews.text: My cat got out of this harness. I had it pretty tight, but something scared him and he flailed and squirmed and was on his back. Suddenly he was running away and I was holding an empty harness and he was nowhere to be seen. Like another poster said, you're going to have to practically strangle your cat to be safe, and even then it might not be tight enough. Luckily my story has a happy ending and he was hiding in my parking lot and ran out howling hysterically when I came over, but I got very, very lucky. A scared cat is ridiculously fast and you may never see yours again.
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard Monster

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made and Easy to Adjust
customer_reviews.text: I used this harness to train an 8 week old kitten. I was training the kitten for nursing home visits so he could provided therapy to the people who lived there. The harness fit very well and was easily adjustable. The kitten did not even pay attention to it after it was put on.
customer_reviews.author: SiamicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES going outside on this leash/harness! I got the size large for my big 20 pound cat and it fits him perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AutyB87

customer_reviews.title: BUY A NORMAL HARNESS
customer_reviews.text: NOT SAFE. I have a Bengal cat and he can back his way out of this in 2 hot seconds. It fits correctly, but this is not made for a smart cat. Unfortunately this was a waste of my money and time as I chased him for an hour this morning. I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: She had so much fun outside and was even leaping for joy into the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a really mean and wild cat. She has never been outside before. She threw a fit when I put this on her and growled, hissed and scratched me all up. Totally worth it. She had so much fun outside and was even leaping for joy into the air. When we finally came inside she was so tired and was actually really sweet! Going outside let her release alot of built up energy. She cant go out alone bc we live on a very busy highway and she is still very young. It fit perfect and Im so glad I bought this. 5 stars! Thanks alot.
customer_reviews.author: Binks mom

customer_reviews.title: Fat cat approved!
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of hard to figure out how to get it on my cat, especially since she hates having her space invaded. But she's been wanting to go outside for so long (she's a former street cat) and I live next to a busy road so I can't let her out unattended. She's "substantial" at 13 pounds and I opted for the large harness. It fits her pretty good (I think...it's a little hard to figure out but it stays on!!) I'm very happy with this purchase and although she hates being on a leash she really is enjoying being able to go outside!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: "PS" to my recent review......practice LOTS in a secured area b4 venturing outdoors!!!
customer_reviews.text: in my last review I remarked that my kitty slipped the harness.....she almost got away. Latest news: this lead is good if you familiarizes yrslf with its mechanics, and practice, practice, PRACTICE putting it on, getting the right fit(three fingers comfortably under kitty's harness).....in a secured area where yr pet is safe to take off ......if it happens. I like this style harness for HOT weather.....the other harness from Amazon I purchased is a "shirt" harness , secure enough, but too hot for kitty this summer season. Happy trails!
customer_reviews.author: Patches

customer_reviews.title: Nice Harness
customer_reviews.text: Kitten loves leash training. Walking outside . . . He is very small and agile - also considers it a fun challenge to get out ( 10 minutes, he will bring it back to have the human put it back on so he can try again ). Kitten waits until we get back inside before he does his escape trick. It can be tightened more but putting it on little kitten is also play time - plastic clips can pinch kitty - < 1/2 pinky slack
customer_reviews.author: q256

customer_reviews.title: This one really works!
customer_reviews.text: This cat harness is the first one we've found that is escape proof. As long as it's adjusted correctly. We're planning an extended trip in our camping trailer and decided it was a bit unfair to leave our cat at home. So we've started training her on leash. At first she was a 10 pound weight, but eventually she's gotten used to the harness and actually looks forward to it since it means we're going outside. My only qualm is that the material on the bungee leash attracts every twig, blade of grass and sticker nearby. Not a big deal but annoying. Elsie the cat says "THANKS"!
customer_reviews.author: Runnerz

customer_reviews.title: My cat hates this
customer_reviews.text: The amount of hilarious videos we have been able to make by putting this thing on my cat, combined with the quality of the product is why it gets 5 stars. We cannot walk our cat with this because she a jerk and won't do it but if she would walk and do what we want.. this would have been a great purchase. It is well made and fits her really well once we ninja fight with her to put it on but we can't use it the way we want because she sucks. Great leash tho if you have a better cat.
customer_reviews.author: kasey kruft

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: Leash training ended up being much easier than I thought it would be. I read the instructions and a few online guides to learn how to train. Here are a few of the nice features: 1. It fits large cats. My cat is 15 pounds and the large size fits well. 2. It removes easily. Training requires stopping as soon as it becomes unpleasant for kitty. After unsecuring the clips, the harness solid slips right off. 3. It comes with a nice leash that has plenty of give.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Used this for years
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these for years for my last cat it works well when out and about on leash. Never leave your cat alone in it. I reinforced the slider that adjusts the size hook end with either a safety pin or a zip tie. I let the boys run around the house with it on for a week and one did manage to loose it in the couch so not for unsupervised use. Oh and don't get a small unless your walking a large ferret or they kitten. Large fits my 5 and 6 month Savannah cats with room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree

customer_reviews.title: Seemed Nice, but then the escape ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally figured out to put the harness on. It looked nice, but it needed to be tightened down. I left it a bit loose and the cat seemed comfortable walking around with it without the lease. The cat normally follows me around anyway, but I wanted to walk the cat for more exercise instead of getting a dog. Anyway, the catch wondered around a bit with me then went off somewhere. The cat came back without the harness. I need to order another. Looked like it had great promise. I would prefer Velcro. The tabs are a bit tough to connect with one hand. Takes a bit too much effort. Corrected it could be easily done with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: USAJET

customer_reviews.title: Mickey Mouse Quality
customer_reviews.text: If your cat is a large, hefty-type cat...it won't work. The locks seem to be too flimsy and small for a large cat; they are hard to close and hard to open; the leash I found to be very narrow and short. It would be okay for a small to middle size cat, but I still feel your money would be better spent on another choice. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: QBan008

customer_reviews.title: Fine harness, but it is not secure
customer_reviews.text: The harness is great ...BUT the moveable rubber slide which is supposed to keep the harness in place cannot be fixed in place. I've bought three of these--The first one worked well. I could tighten the harness and the slide remained in place, but the second and the third have a different rubber slide which does not work. My cat is 18 lbs. and pulls out of it easily, so that I have to be very careful that he is not backing out of the harness. What is needed is some sort of a small clamp that could be used to keep it in place. Would love the ideas of others on this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Mc

customer_reviews.title: Not my first pic
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty good and could be perfect with a different cat, I'm sure. However, my biggin' was not having it one day (the neighbor came over to greet him and he gets shy) and he got himself out VERY easily. For cats who get scared, or chase birds, or any cat you think my try to get out - just know they can. When he didn't try to get out, it worked well and the walks were nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our fourth, yes, FOURTH harness we've purchased becuase they are so great. Our two kitties outgrew the original ones and now that they're adults we had to get them new harnesses. They love being outside, and most importantly because the harness goes over their chest even when they tug on the leash or bounce too far it doesn't choke them. We are totally happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Mix

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The bungie leash allowed my cat to leap forward and then be yanked back to the point where he though I was doing it on purpose. The design of the harness makes it so that you have to adjust and tighten it around your cat, and then un-tighten to take it off. So it's a struggle to get it how it needs to be every single time. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Qara

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Less constricting.
customer_reviews.text: I like how it's not as constricting for Thor. He's a very large cat and I don't even put a collar on him although he's chipped and he's an indoor cat primarily. Sometimes I take him out in a carrier for walks. I wanted to be able to let him out every so often when we stop without fearing he'll bound off. I'm sure if he wants out of it bad enough he could. He's a cat after all.
customer_reviews.author: MLionheart

customer_reviews.title: great idea to let inside cats experience the outdoors safely.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves to be outside but he is an indoor cat for safety reasons. He is age one, long hair and around 10# and the medium fits him perfectly. He did well day one on the porch and pavement but likes to lay down in the grass. I think he will get used to this and it will be perfect. He will be happy to be with our goldens outdoors because he thinks he is a dog :). Great value. The leash stretches just enough.
customer_reviews.author: tammy nienburg

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Unless your cat is pulling on the harness, it does nothing to keep them from slipping out of it. Given the right pressure they will easily slip right out of it. Which defeats the purpose. Had to go down to the pet store and buy another brand. Sadly these are also sold at Petco. Terrible design. The leash isnt bad tho.
customer_reviews.author: Brena

customer_reviews.title: Good but
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** Not a full escape but our cat 🐈 pulled the front half off his shoulder. We needed a new larger harness for our cat. This claims to be escape proof. Well... that's nearly true. While he never actually got the entire thing completely off, it at first slip off from its proper shoulder position. Readjusting the harness again and adding an additional rubber band and so far today its held correctly. We'll see how its goes as it was at night he nearly escaped from it.
customer_reviews.author: M M

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: While there are things I like about this harness, mainly it is minimal material, it is a pain to put on. My cat likes it ok, but because I is such a pain to put on, and you have to adjust it with the little rubber grommet gismo every time. I decided to buy another one that you just adjust once and you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Benway

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kitten!
customer_reviews.text: The small was the perfect size for my four month old kitten, and he absolutely loves it and getting to explore outside! Not a huge fan of the leash that comes with it so I went ahead and used a different one, but these have been the best harnesses for my cats as they aren't bulky and are easy for them to walk in. It is possible for them to slip out by backing up, but they are always under constant supervision when wearing the harness or going outside so not a huge deal for me, mine have not once escaped!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hahn-Stumpf

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful harnesses for cats who walk well on leash
customer_reviews.text: My not-yet-1-year cat guy isn't ready for this harness, and I couldn't get the one I received on to him, a combination of not having had a go-for-a-walk cat for a few decades and the cat (kitten) himself who just didn't want to wear it. No biting but lots of other "no thanks" tricks, so after 15 minutes he had the best of me and I gave up. I'll try again after he's a little older. Vendor did not require me to send the harness and leash back. I appreciate that, and donated it so that someone else's pussycat will be able to go for walks.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel

customer_reviews.title: It runs small.
customer_reviews.text: It really looks great and you get the leash with it which is a great deal. I do like all the ways which you can adjust the harness and that had work well to be able to get the best adjustment for our kitten. We originally bought the S size for out 12 weeks old kitten but that was too small for her so we replaced it for the M size which fits her well. I like that it’s minimal but yet seem to be secure. I can’t say for sure that our cats won’t get out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Na’ama Devivo

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a laugh, but was pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a joke just to see my husband’s reaction. M He thinks it’s ridiculous and my cats were confused as to what was happening. As far as the product goes though, it’s great! Instructions are easy to follow and make sure you measure for the right size. Fits the safely and snugly. Feels sturdy and well made too. Maybe I’ll actually try this for real this summer!
customer_reviews.author: T. Voyles

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: The leash and harness are really good; the weave of the straps is soft so it wasn't abrasive against my cat. As for "inescapably", my cat didn't even try, so I really don't know, but the way it loops around their shoulders made me think it was unlikely. I really like the elasticity of the leash. Because of that I'm not sure my cat even knew she was leashed lol
customer_reviews.author: Anna Marlay

customer_reviews.title: Cat can bite open clips, beware. Otherwise recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, except my cat can easily escape by biting open the clips. One of the clips also broken from her bite, though it still holds. Even with masking tape around the clip, she can bite it open. This will not be a problem if you watch every move your cat makes, but something to know before trusting your cat to be secure with this system outdoors. I need to find another way to stop her from opening the clips still, I am not sure I’ve seen a better one, and don't want to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Not escape proof
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a "better" cat harness for some time and got this one because it appeared better built than the cheaper ones. It is better built but unfortunately cats can escape from it just as easily. Don't risk taking your cats outside with this thing. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd in Harlem

customer_reviews.title: Good design for cats
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for my new little kittens that are four months old. They are much better then traditional H style harnesses and my kittens are too small for the one that look like a vest. The nice part about this type is that it applies pressure on their shoulders not their necks if they pull. Included is a handy little start guide on fitting and how to encourage your kitty to get used to the harness. The leash is elasticized so the tug when they reach the end isn't so jarring. At some point I'll update with pics.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile comfort and safety
customer_reviews.text: We now have two of these for our cats and they love them, a little hard to adjust at first if they don't want them on but our cats don't care for things on their body or collars but will wear these without any fight and will let us put them on if they know they're getting to go for a walk. The bungee leash is great for helping to lead them as well without tugging at them, just a gentle pull can get them to follow the path or direction without really pulling then
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: If your cat is going to show you cat butt, you might as well excise together and have some "Catification" time.
customer_reviews.text: I have an energetic albeit overweight cat who was adopted semi-feral. Although microchiped; I won't let him wander alone living so close to a wooded area where we have raccoon, deer, foxes, and the usual squirrel and bunnies.His first month home he sent me to the hospital with 'cat scratch fever' for six days, and although we've come to an understanding, I admit the extra exercise has done his personality good. Quality product., no harm to feline, easy to use, and once he's used to it, I know longer have to drag walk him. Environmentally friendly packaging. Easy to follow instructions for those of us who are too used to 'cat butt'.
customer_reviews.author: A.Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good harness/leash
customer_reviews.text: Good leash, the harness is a bit confusing and difficult to get on a cat that doesn't like harnesses. It is well made and the pink color is very nice, I got pink because it is my favorite color and I didn't think my cat really cared. However, the quality and color were not enough to win approval in the eyes of my cat, who promptly glued himself to the floor as soon as I put it on him and would not budge. But it does suffice to get him to and from the vet without a cat carrier, he hates cat carriers. If the harness was a bit less confusing I would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: yoda

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness is great. I was worried that it would be uncomfortable for my cat, but once she got used to it, it actually seems to be MORE comfortable and less restrictive than a vest-style harness. To be fair, my cats are really chill and don’t try to get out of it, so I’m not sure how effective it is on that count.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: We love this harness
customer_reviews.text: My kitten LOVES to go outside and for rides. After trying a few harness brands, a girl at my local pet store suggested I try this brand. They didn't have the right size, so I got it here. It's awesome. It took a bit to figure out how to put it on, and there is a learning curve to harnessing the cat in, but once we got past that, it works great. If my kitten hears me take it down she runs to the door. It allows her to go outside safely. She loves to play in my flower beds and chase butterflies! I even take her with me on short car rides to the park. It's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Peng

customer_reviews.title: Most good, some quality issues
customer_reviews.text: My cat is an adept escape artist and he's only gotten out of this one once (and I'm pretty sure I didn't have it tight enough). It seems fairly effective at stopping him because it tightens at the shoulders instead of around the neck. It's lightweight so he doesn't hate having it on. I like that it slips over the head rather than having holes for the legs. Unfortunately one of the plastic sliders broke about two weeks in so I have to over-adjust the other side to make it tight enough. Parts of the webbing are already fraying as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wham

customer_reviews.title: Decent harness but you just need to modify it a little check my review.
customer_reviews.text: Good harness for my cat. I bought the small first and it was great for about a month or so. I then ordered the next size up med but when I received it was a huge difference in size from the small harness. The only problem I have with the harness is the little rubber ring to adjust size it just slides down and makes the harness loose. I still use the harness I just adjusted to the right size and put a zip tie behind the rubber ring and now it stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Keith ouimette

customer_reviews.title: Worked Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: My one year old Siamese had no problem with this harness from the very first try. I had a toy for him to play with while I adjusted it, and all was fine. My cat weighs 13 lbs. and I found that the medium size harness was just right. I would highly recommend, at least for the Siamese breed, that you purchase the large size if your cat is any heavier. The harness comes with excellent tips for introducing it to your cat, and full instructions. A very good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Tightened harness still didn't secure my cat
customer_reviews.text: Though I love the idea of this harness and it was beautiful and fit my cat perfectly, it did NOT work. I tightened it so that the harness was secure and safe without actually choking the life out of my cat, and we brought her outside. The leash did not quite pull tight and she started to freak out, followed shortly by her wriggling out of the harness and getting away. She was lost for 48 hours before we managed to catch her in a HavaHart trap. I am extremely disappointed in this product. I thought it would prevent things like this from happening and yet I almost didn't get my sweet girl back.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah DeBouter

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good harness but my cat was able to loosen the straps. He hasn't gotten out of it but I think he could if he kept struggling. He's a small cat (6 months old and about 7-8lbs) and I got the medium. Seemed to fit him just fine with room to grow. He didn't seem to mind the harness once it was on him for the most part. Edit: He got smart and chewed off a buckle. Looking for a new harness now sadly. Still love the leash though
customer_reviews.author: tinyninja47

customer_reviews.title: Cat is happy to go out, I'm happy she can't bite through the harness
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality, and a bit confusing to put on the first few times, but once you get the hang of it, it's all good. My cat has managed to make it frizz up, but after a few solid months, still can't seem to gnaw through it! My cat can't weasel her way out of the harness unless she's really trying and i'm pulling on the leash, so thats a relief. The cat got a little mad at me the first time i put it on, but after getting used to it, she doesn't mind and is happy to be able to go outside!
customer_reviews.author: bubbles

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but keep it adjusted firm.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good harness. Our rambunctious Kitty was finding ways to crawl out of it sometimes. Otherwise it was a good way to introduce a small kitten to a yard with Hawks. Once she's bigger, we'll let the kitty go and hope for the best. We need a cat to keep down the rodents on our 3 acres. We have breeding houses for songbirds and consider our cat's impact on songbirds to be neutral.
customer_reviews.author: hoytpr

customer_reviews.title: Good cat harness and leash set
customer_reviews.text: I ordered size medium for my petite 7lb cat. This cat doesn’t like the harness but after forcing him to wear it around the house, he is starting to accept it. Once you attach the harness correctly, it will self adjust if the cat is in harness attached to the leash. This is impossible for the cat to get out of. If you have a cat toy on a stick, it helps to distract cat and get cat used to harness and leash. I’m looking forward to taking cat outside once he is used to being on leash. Excellent quality and design set.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyx3Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: My cat now recognizes this as the sign that he's going out and he gets super excited. Very easy to resize, put on the cat, and it seems secure enough AS LONG AS your cat is calm. I bought size medium for my 9lb cat.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Cats may hate it, but works well
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates this, but calms down once I take her outside and let her forget about the leash for a bit. If your cat is trying to roll out of the leash and pull away, she could possibly do so. I freaked out a bit when the leash just slid right off my cat's bum as she tried to get away. Luckily she doesn't go far and is too cautious to be to far from me, but I had a brief freak out sesh. I will keep working with the leash on her, and make sure it's tightened correctly (takes a few tries to get right, to be honest).
customer_reviews.author: Bradencn

customer_reviews.title: Cat escaped immediately
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a variety of small dog and cat harnesses for my 15 lb recently adopted cat that demands to go outside. Of course I had to try this one, as it’s designed specifically for cats and to prevent choking. This harness was apparently so comfortable for my cat that he was able to slip out as if he was wearing nothing at all! I just spent two hours looking for him and fending off a neighborhood tomcat who wanted to fight or eat the can of food i was using to lure my cat back inside. Maybe this harness is for harness training inside only...
customer_reviews.author: Lizaveta

customer_reviews.title: My cat escaped pretty easily.....
customer_reviews.text: We practiced using this harness for weeks, tightening it more and more each time. It was very difficult to put on and the straps always seemed twisted. The silicone ball on the top that is meant to hold the shoulder straps tighter did not serve its purpose and would loosen back up within seconds. Every time my cat had this on, she was super calm and would just lay down. That was perfectly fine with me since I was planning on using it with a bungee car seat buckle attachment for our cross country trip. Unfortunately she escaped out of the harness within the first 30 seconds of being on the road. Womp womp.
customer_reviews.author: PSB8479

customer_reviews.title: Prince can now go out and lay in the grass  Yay for Prince
customer_reviews.text: First harness he is not getting out of. without making it so tight that I am worried about hurting him. I can see that it would be a looooooong process to get my 10 year old cat to actually take a walk. But her can lay out and enjoy the grass I do add and extra old leash for more freedom. I know that he isn't happy about losing his freedom but he comes to me when I take it out and allows me to put it on him since he knows he gets to go out. I don't have to worry about the neighbor animals.
customer_reviews.author: Pat F

customer_reviews.title: Great for supervised adventures.
customer_reviews.text: The harness is made well. The leash is flexible while also allowing you to stay close and keep an eye on your cat. Let common sense be your guide: •Don’t tie the leash to something—always hold the leash. •Stay behind your cat, while holding the leash, so they won’t back out of the harness. •Don’t expect the cat to sit still when you want them to. •Walk around with them and let them explore while you keep them safe.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: For trained cats only. Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Love the bungee leash. Saved my cat countless times from hurting himself (dog charged at him and it kept him from running away but also not choking him). That being said be careful because if your kitten only weighs 3 pounds still chance of breaking away. Learned my lesson when I had it on too loose. Before it could tighten it actually just snapped off. Overall it’s good but I’d advise training your cat in a small enclosed space and yard waaaaayyyy before you actually walk it around so you can get a feel of the mechanism and not traumatize cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to get your cat some safe outdoor time
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get your indoor cat some outdoor play time. Obviously something like this is not gonna be great for really energetic/crazy cats, if not adjusted right a cat could definitely pull a quick move and escape this thing. It's perfect for our cat however. She's pretty timid and enjoys being able to get outside and roll around in the dirt. The leash, although a bungee type, is a bit short. I need to walk pretty close behind her and it makes her weirded out I think. The whole thing goes together about as simply as I think a cat harness could, and there is plenty of adjustment to make it fit our cat well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mark Knisley

customer_reviews.title: Did not stay securely fastened
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this harness did not go around my cat's neck but rather his chest and shoulders. However, the small rubber ring that slides forward to secure the harness does not stay in place. If tension is kept on the leash it's usually ok, but there were several instances where it loosened up to the point where my cat could get out of it if he wanted to. He didn't mind wearing it and I liked the design except for the rubber ring problem. Love the bungee leash and continue to use it on an H-style harness that I purchased to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: J-NM

customer_reviews.title: The Fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's first experience with a harness and leash. It is very easy to put on the cat and the girth is perfect, however, I can not keep the chest strap high enough that is doesn't eventually slide down to just above her legs. This causes her to walk abnormally and allows her to step through the chest straps when she and I don't want to go the same way. I was going to return it, but will first talk to the company to see if they have any suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite harness
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd replace my first one with a different brand, as the silicon O ring wore out after a year. However, my Kitty just didn't like any of the others-- balking even though she loves her walks. This brand, she comes running and shoves her head in, ready for her walk. The first time I unpacked the replacement of this brand, she seemed to recognize it immediately and came running before I even called out the "Lets go Walking" command.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Geekette

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a great harness and leash for my kitty. The harness adjusts for the head/neck size, making it easier to slip over her head, which is great. However, it does loosen up with movement & allows for my cat to pull out of the harness. I've solved this by using a small binder clip to hold the rubber ring in place (cat doesn't even notice it). The stretch in the leash is great, giving kitty a little extra room to roam.
customer_reviews.author: DawnieC

customer_reviews.title: Harness Houdini
customer_reviews.text: While the product was a great fix to our harness / leash needs, our cat is apparently an escape artist and can wriggle her way out of it. If we tighten it more, she can’t/won’t move and just lays on the ground. We’ve speculated that wider straps on the harness and a longer strap on the top of the back between where her shoulder blade straps meet and the leash latches may help with these issues. Or maybe our cat’s just a ninja, and we need to accept that.
customer_reviews.author: Adelle

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to apply to kitty
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. But, don’t let kitty turn around towards you and start pulling backwards. She will wiggle it off! I have it tightened on her, her skin is able to flex it off by pulling backwards. She walks a bit, I have added a runner wire on it. Works great, until she chooses to pull backwards. I always find her in the yard. No issues. No worries.
customer_reviews.author: srkc

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes this one.
customer_reviews.text: Although this harness takes more time to put on, my cat likes it better. With the other harness, he walked like he had a weight on his back! He was able to walk out of the other harness almost as soon as he reached the end of the lease, so far he hasn’t escaped from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cats

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, flexible, cat-friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness because my cat doesn't care if he has to wear it. This is the second harness we tried -- he hated the first one, but when we put this on him he doesn't seem to mind any more than he does wearing a collar. It's adjustable in every dimension and easy to put on due to the dual-clip design. The included leash is great as well because of the springy material used, but our cat doesn't seem interested in testing the limits of the leash length anyway so I can't speak to how resistive it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the leash alone
customer_reviews.text: This is so much cheaper than in the pet store. I wish the harness didn't require going over head to put on, my cat gets freaked out by that, it would be a great lighter option for summer hikes if I could get her in it. Regardless I think its a great deal for the leash alone. The bungee style allows the cat to move at their pace without feeling restrained and provides light resistance to get them walking when they wont stop chewing grass behind you lol
customer_reviews.author: starvingcollegestudent

customer_reviews.title: Good for kittens
customer_reviews.text: I got this in a small for my 3.5 month old kitten and it works great. The quality is very nice - especially compared to some of the harnesses I looked at in a few pet stores. My only complaint is that I have to keep tightening it throughout his walks. The little rubber piece that is supposed to keep it tight often slides around, so I think a cat that really wanted to get out of it could. Also, this isn't a problem for me, but I could see it being difficult to put the harness around a cats head.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Holderman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Cat
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd harness for my cat (having to previously try a dog harness--too long in the chest), and a cat harness (too small because he's a big boy....15 lb Siberian). This is easy to put on over their head, yet very secure to keep the cat safe. Love the "elastic" leash too. Extremely easy to adjust--in fact, we put it on too lose on purpose, and just slip it tighter once on. Highly recommend for cats!
customer_reviews.author: debits&credits

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cat that has been an indoor cat but would love to be out occasionally. I found this to be too complicated with very small straps that twist easily. It is critical that it be adjusted very carefully, not easy on a cat that wants nothing to do with a harness. Once on the straps are very tight and I did not find it to be escape proof. My cat did not wiggle his way out, but it was a concern for me as he was trying his best to escape. I decided it was not worth the risk, so he is going to have to remain an indoor only cat.
customer_reviews.author: W. G.  sq.1

customer_reviews.title: Used to start harness training foster kittens at about 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to start harness training foster kittens at about 4 weeks old and 1-ish pounds. Wouldn't hVe taken them outside as it was too big then, but a month and a pound later, my 2 and 2.5 lb 8-week kittens had a ball at the park in their (fully tightened) harnesses. Could they get out of them if they really wanted? Absolutely. Cat bones are made of rubber. But it takes a while to get both sets of straps off and if you start training early, they won't be squirrels enough to want to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K.

customer_reviews.title: Best cat harness ever
customer_reviews.text: These harnesses are well tolerated. The smallest one works well on kittens. I do foster and like to get them used to them. Great for safety when traveling if cat escapes from car. Happens it seems all the time. I used mine inside the carrier on the plane. I attached the lead inside the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Another Bella approved product!
customer_reviews.text: Really good for cats! My cat is very small not even 7pounds although a full grown adult, the harness....it doesn't work for her, however, the bungee leash is great. She walks with it and doesn't feel confined. Worth getting. I would like it to be a bit lighter, it is quite heavier than what it needs to be, at least in my opinion, but it doesn't bother her at all.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Really good value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just for the leash, having purchased a MUCH more expensive harness for my cat. As it turns out, the expensive harness was a no go. After a week of trying to get it on her, I decided to try this one. It was much easier than I thought it would be, and she tolerated it surprisingly well (especially given how adamantly she felt about the other one). We haven't been walking yet, but she's been wearing it for several hours, and has even forgiven me for putting it on her - so far, so good! Will update if I experience any problems with it in future.
customer_reviews.author: K. Heil

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This harness and lead are sturdy and seem comfortable. At first my large and rambunctious cat was having none of it. But when I sat in the floor by the door he got the picture. He now stands by the door and waits for the harness so he can go outside. He hasn’t quite got the idea of walking on a leash... but we are working on that.
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: Safe, and secure. Comfortable so my cat accepts it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes wears this collar attached to a light weight plastic rope when he goes with me to the garden. It's easy to put on. He doesn't pull on it or try to get out of it as he has with other collars. This time I bought a size large. He grew out of the medium at 16#. I am guessing the large will accommodate approximately 16 to 22 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Carol Walter

customer_reviews.title: It fits her comfortably though. I like the product because I can ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to walk my cat a few times. Sometimes she will walk in it and other times she doesn't want to. That's a cat for you. It fits her comfortably though. I like the product because I can bring her outside to sit with me and she won't go far away. I've actually ordered 2 of these because she outgrew the first one.
customer_reviews.author: happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Too tight for 13-pound cat
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these so our cats can safely go outside. We've used it for our 13-pound cat. It's too small. He oddly enough doesn't seem to mind it, but he sure doesn't walk around very much. We are getting a collar for him so he's more comfortable. Our 10-pound cat has no interest in going out, and really doesn't like to be touched, so I haven't tried it on him. If this harness fit our bigger cat, it would be a wonderful product--keeps him in the yard and the birds safe. It's easy to get on and off; it's just way too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Orange-Poppy

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I love these harness & bungee leashes. I have a small, medium & a large. There is a big difference between sizes. The small is pretty tiny so if you have a smaller 3-5 mo. old kitten & want to get them started it would be great. It is already too tight for our 5 mo. old boy. The medium is still really too big for him but I am using it around the house anyway. He will be growing more soon. I add a regular leash on to the bungee for my Lucy who is 10 to 11 lbs. She wears the large & is a camping cat.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie from Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: I can't sing enough praises
customer_reviews.text: I can't sing this harnesses praises enough. Having been forced to move to the city, my indoor/outdoor cats were now regulated to being purely indoor and they hated it. When I first heard of a kitty harness, I was very skeptical about its effectiveness and safety, but not only does this safely restrain my cats so that we can take them out, its wide range of adjustability allows both my skinny and my chunky cat to fit. As far as quality, it's well-made, doesn't hurt the cats and stands up even against strenuous wear. Definite 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if your cat will let you
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this harness set with the hopes of introducing my cat to the outdoors. I slowly introduced the harness and leash but unfortunately she didn’t take to it. I felt that it was easy to put on her and it fit well. Good quality, had she been outside I would have felt secure about the fit and security of the buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This is the only cat harness and leash you should buy! That's our experience.
customer_reviews.text: The best harness and leash! We bought this to train our kitten. It fits great and the adjusts easy. The small is a bit big for our kitten (8 weeks) but we double clip it to the leash so she is more secure and have it adjusted to the tightest we can get it. She OWNS her harness and is so proud of it. The quality of the product is nice and the clips are perfect. We ordered two different cat harnesses and I'd choose this again. The bunch leash is definitely what you want for a cat. Plus the harness makes them feel secure.
customer_reviews.author: mamala

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Color is beautiful. The instructions are easy. I have used it a few times now. Just make sure it's snug and the rubber stopper is pulled tight to keep it from getting loose or your cat will slip out. My boy acts like he's a pro already. He lets me strap him up. He def leads me more than I lead him. I love how the straps go around the shoulders instead of the neck. The bungy leash is awesome. Very cat friendly. He is eating catnip in his photos :)
customer_reviews.author: roxanne

customer_reviews.title: The harness is very comfortable for him--it doesn't bind and it seems to hold ...
customer_reviews.text: I traveled by plane with my cat and we had to go through security. Also, he is an indoor/outdoor cat and we moved to Mexico. I had to keep him on the harness/leash for the first few weeks while he got used to his new home. The harness is very comfortable for him--it doesn't bind and it seems to hold him well--he never slipped out of it. I started by having him wear the harness around the house before we moved, so that he was used to it. I got worried and also ordered the TSA harness with all plastic on it, but he hated it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 10 week old kitten
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to start training our 10 year old kitten to use a harness. I love that it's adjustable so as she grows bigger I can adjust it. She's 12 weeks now and has no issues with exploring outdoors in the backyard and in parks. My advice is to start a kitten with this harness, and evaluate switching to a harness that has more fabric and support when s/he gets older. We tried to get her one of the ones with more fabric first and had to return it cus it was too big.
customer_reviews.author: Lani Powell

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best harness for a cat it’s adjustable and secure and they don’t mind it . I would definitely recommend this and I always read the reviews so I’d thought I write one because I’m so happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia williams

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: It's good, but you have to make sure it doesn't get loose and slip over the cat's body, which has happened. I have to adjust it a few times while it is on when it gets loose around the neck. My cat gets excited whenever I whip it out because she knows she's going outside. But it isn't the easiest to put on, and my cat gets frustrated with my efforts to get it on. Regardless, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: NaturalPoet

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our Siamese as an alternative to a crate when introducing him to the car and a new house. The harness itself is very well made and sturdy. It's easier to put on than it looks fortunately. However, the harness runs small - according to the measurements, Free Cat should have fit in it, but it was like trying to put him in a corset. I had to exchange it or risk the wrath of an offended cat.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable and they make it possible for the fur babies to go outside
customer_reviews.text: I love how adjustable these are; only my older cat has figured out how to escape from hers when she feels the need. I have three cats and three harnesses to enable my cats to go outside. They actually associate the harnesses with outside time now and don't hate the harnesses because of that. This is the only harness I have found that is adjustable enough to contain most of my cats, most of the time. They're cute on the cats too.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Parker

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to fit, but perfect besides!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it can be a bit difficult to fit on the cat at first. Once it is properly adjusted it holds them well, however, and seems to be keeping from any one spot having too much constriction. It may take some time for your cat to grow accustomed to the harness and especially to following your lead. The bungee helps you give gradual inpu. Have lots of patience!
customer_reviews.author: davethedev

customer_reviews.title: Safe, stury and lightweight cat harness and leash!! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping!! Secured in plastic container and box. Ordered in dark blue. Just like in pic. Very strong and study leash and harness and love thats its not heavy bt lightweight. Very easy to put on cat and off. Very secured, that I dont have to worry, that it'll come loose, when Im outide walking my cat. Will purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay on
customer_reviews.text: I tried both the small and medium for my young cat. Neither will stay on him. The harness itself is as advertised and the colored straps help keep it oriented, but no matter how many times I try, he always finds a way to slip out of it. I wouldn't suggest this for any young cats/kittens, but it might be okay for an adult cat who's more calm and tolerant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small dog
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. It is a nice bungee leash and lets my dog go in the grass while I stay on road. The harness works fine for a dog, although I like dog harnesses better. But whenI want to show her off the matching leash and harness are so cute,
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Harshman

customer_reviews.title: It worked at first
customer_reviews.text: My step dad needed these to keep his outside cats from roaming around in the neighborhood. At first, it worked pretty well. We had it snug on the cats and they seemed like they knew their limits. However, the youngest one figured out how to consistently get out of the harness just by going backwards. After that, he could never be kept on it. However, for the older one, it seemed like it helped him be more leash trained and he started to stick around more. So it's a hit or a miss depending on your cat's personality.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Funny way to let kitty explore
customer_reviews.text: The comedic value alone in watching kitty walk around the back yard on a leash is priceless. Pros: - Kitty cannot get out of the harness - The bungee-like line gives kitty a little more play other than the length of the leash - Hours of entertainment of watching kitty on a leash Cons: - None that I have found
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy two of these for my adult cats because of a cross state move. These harnesses are shaped very well, they do not strangle your cat and are easily adjusted. A determined or frightened cat can still wiggle out of one if you are incautious, but, as I said, these are very good at not strangling your cat such as a cheap figure-8 harness might. The leash though, is too short. I had to attach another 5 foot leash onto the bungee section of the leash in order for my cats and me to be comfortable walking along. That worked out well. My cats are large, 25/27 pounds adults.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - adjustable - light wright
customer_reviews.text: I love this kitty harness. My cat took really well to it. I originally bought it just for the leash part. I bought another kitty harness but it didn’t have the leash. But turns out, my cat did not like the other harness, and to me it was to restricting. But not this one! I just wish the leash was longer. I am going to look into buying a longer one. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: Harness came as expected. Cat hates being in a harness, but it was easy to put it on her regardless
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not Escape proof
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large and it was not big enough. The top strap that hold the rings needs to be longer. I put this on my cat as tight as I could without chocking him and he still got out of it. I was looking for something I could you to let my cat stay outside without running away.
customer_reviews.author: kav1025

customer_reviews.title: Need help
customer_reviews.text: The harness does not stay secure, the black rubber stopper moves around and doesn’t keep the shoulder straps in place. Kitten and I are both struggling to make this work so she can do more stuff. Is there a defect with my rubber stopper or could I be doing something wrong? When the leash is on she just goes circle nuts within seconds, with no leash she lasts a few minutes before she try’s to escape. She is only 11 weeks old and very much loves petting and snuggles. Can anyone help with suggestions or comments, maybe this just isn’t the right kind for her at approximately 3 to 4 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Everson

customer_reviews.title: This is nice. I like the bungee cord and the idea
customer_reviews.text: This is nice. I like the bungee cord and the idea, but cats need to be well trained to walk on a leash before using this harness as it is easier for them to escape this. It is adjustable, but the adjusters are loose and it loosens up on it's own while the cat is resting. That means if something startles them, they can more easily get out of the harness! If your cat is bigger and more accustomed to being out with you though, I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Eyrie Mase

customer_reviews.title: This is nice. I like the bungee cord and the idea
customer_reviews.text: This is nice. I like the bungee cord and the idea, but cats need to be well trained to walk on a leash before using this harness as it is easier for them to escape this. It is adjustable, but the adjusters are loose and it loosens up on it's own while the cat is resting. That means if something startles them, they can more easily get out of the harness! If your cat is bigger and more accustomed to being out with you though, I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Eyrie Mase

customer_reviews.title: Even the Large size is too small
customer_reviews.text: I carefully checked all product descriptions and information as my newly adopted Siberian Forest Cat is very large. The Harness, per the information, in the Large size, should have worked. However, once I finally got it put on him (instructions were unclear) I found it to be extremely tight. It is not usable by my "Smoky" which is a disappointment as I wanted to be able to take him outside and let him play but must have a form of control as we are 1/2 block from the freeway. This is delayed as I lost my internet in mid April and only today, 6/2/18, am able to go online again.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth T

customer_reviews.title: My cat is a Houdini
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something safe for my cat, so we would be able to take her out for a walk. Somehow she managed to get out of this harness within 2 minutes. I'm not sure that it was because of the string style or the product had problems. But we ended up getting something safer.
customer_reviews.author: TimiZora

customer_reviews.title: Great harness, great company!
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason this is the highest rated & recommended cat harness! It's really great! Sizing is good, & it's a very sturdy & safe harness. My cat is not able to escape. It is also lightweight & non-restrictive for her. I especially loved when I was unpacking the harness, the information about how outdoor cats negatively effect bird populations. Education is so important! Seems like a reputable company & product that I would support again!
customer_reviews.author: Corinthian McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: This tiny harness does not look like much but I had tremendous success. I have 4 kittens (not yet full grown) and this fit all of them them just fine. The attachments are small, but mighty. NONE OF THEM EVER GOT OUT OF IT WITHOUT A HUMAN TO DO THE JOB..SO NO GETTING LOOSE WHEN TOURING THE NEIGHBORHOOD...
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Lancaster

product_meta.title: PetSafe Come with Me Kitty Harness and Bungee Leash, Harness for Cats
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:ROYAL BLUE/NAVYThe Petsafe Come With Me Kitty Harness gives you gentle, comfortable control of your cat or kitten, while allowing her to explore the world outside your door. The patented design allows for a gentle pressure on the leash to cradle your cat as you walk, restraining forward motion without harsh pulling or discomfort. The adjustable sternum slide allows you to create a custom fit for your cat's body type, while the dual adjustment points on the girth strap allow a snug, safe fit. The shoulder straps glide through the two D-rings on the back, allowing an increase of tension (when needed) to restrain your cat without choking. The elastic bungee leash provides a little extra "give" to soften the effect of kitty reaching the end of the leash while walking. For the best possible fit, always measure your cat to get the right size. Measurements: Small: 9-11 in. girth; Medium: 10.5-14 in. girth; Large: 13-18 in. girth.
feature_bullets: Quality and performance driven products for your pet
Provide a better quality of living for your pet with Petsafe
age range description: All Life Stages
Nylon harness and bungee leash for small cats or kittens
Sternum slide adjusts to ensure a perfect fit
Safe restraint with no pressure on delicate throat area
4-foot bungee leash stretches to 6 feet for gentle "give" when walking
Fits cats with 9-11 inch girth; limited lifetime warranty against defects

When ordering the harness, it is important to measure the cat's girth (as shown in the picture in the Product Description section) instead of ordering based on the cat's weight. There are also 2 adjustment points to help achieve proper fit.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
